rooms.label: YOUR_ROOM
rooms.name: your bedroom
rooms.description: You are standing in your bedroom. Perhaps you are a young person who only now, on your 13th birthday, will receive a name. You have a pretty window in the corner overlooking the world outside. There's a door leading to your bathroom to the east, and a door leading to the hall to the south.

exits.description: your bathroom door
exits.travelMessage: You go through the door and enter the bathroom.

exits.description: the door to the hall
exits.travelMessage: You shut the door behind you as you go into the hall.

items.label: POGO_HAMMER
items.name: a pogo hammer
items.description: Your treasured hammer mixed with a pogo stick. This probably shouldn't be left where children can reach it (that's a quip, not a game mechanic).

rooms.label: BATHROOM
rooms.name: your ensuite bathroom
rooms.description: You are in the bathroom attached to your bedroom. There's a toilet, pristine due to your constant efforts to keep it clean, next to a sink and bathtub. You enjoy having your amenities not be a complete mess. The currently closed door to the west leads back to your bedroom.

exits.description: the door
exits.travelMessage: You head back into the bedroom.

rooms.label: HALLWAY
rooms.name: the main hallway in your house
rooms.description:
This is the main hallway in your house that connects the bedrooms with the living room and kitchen. There's a doorway at the end, but it seems boarded up, and you're pretty sure that's because it represents the limits of the game you're in. I guess you're stuck here. In your home. Housetrapped.

Anyways, there's also your bedroom door at the north end.

exits.description: the door to your bedroom
exits.travelMessage: You step into your bedroom, closing the door behind you for privacy.

exits.description: The end of the hall, leading to the living room
exits.travelMessage: Your feelings were wrong, turns out you can pass right through the boards! You go into the living room.

rooms.label: LIVING_ROOM
rooms.name: the communal gathering and hangout room in your house
rooms.description:
You are standing in the living room. It is here that you have formed many memories with many people. But... for some reason who those people are eludes you. You seem to remember something about a boy and his father fighting over cake or something like that... or... was it a girl? Perhaps one set to inherit a major baking corporation.

From here you can go to the kitchen, through the front door to the yard outside, or back to the hallway towards the bedroom.

exits.description: the hall leading to the bedrooms
exits.travelMessage: You walk into the hallway towards the bedrooms.

exits.description: the kitchen of the house
exits.travelMessage: You walk into the kitchen.

exits.description: the front door of the house. There's a neat little window to see people outside, but you don't usually get visitors.
exits.travelMessage: You pull open the front door, letting in a whoosh of wind. It blows your hair into a mess as you step outside, and you brush it out of your eyes.

rooms.label: KITCHEN
rooms.name: the kitchen
rooms.description: The place where food is made. It's completely spotless, everything put away nicely and every surface gleaming. The windows let in plenty of light and let you see that there is an exit back to the living room.

exits.description: the entryway back into the living room
exits.travelMessage: You walk back into the living room.

rooms.label: FRONT_YARD
rooms.name: the yard outside your house's front door
rooms.description: You are outside on the lawn of your house. The grass is green and very healthy-looking. From here you can go back into the house, the backyard, and that's pretty much it.

exits.description: the front door of your house, leading directly to the living room
exits.travelMessage: You pull open the heavy door and are comforted by the familiar sight of your living room. You step in and shut the door behind you.

exits.description: the lawn and yard in the back of your house
exits.travelMessage: Grass and twigs crunch under your feet as you walk around to the back yard.

rooms.label: BACKYARD
rooms.name: your house's backyard
rooms.description:
This is the outside of your house, in the back. There's a nice lawn here, well-kept and manicured, and you see a Pogo ride in a nearby sandbox that seems oddly familiar. Maybe you should stay for a moment and take a break.

From here, you could go back to the front yard. Or, bizarrely, there seems to be an opening in the ground near the pogo ride, so you could go in there.

exits.description: the yard outside of your house's front door
exits.travelMessage: You decide you've had enough of the backyard and decide to go to the front.

exits.description: a dank tunnel leading down into the depths of the earth under your house
exits.travelMessage: You take a deep breath and follow the tunnel underground, past a couple of turns and into the depths.

rooms.label: NPC_HALL
rooms.name: a dark hall in the ground under your house
rooms.description:
You are standing in the middle of a concrete, artificial tunnel underneath your house. At first it feels pitch black, but your eyes slowly adjust and you can make out what's in here by the light of several bioluminescent mushrooms on several of the walls.

There's a set of three antique doors dotting the walls of the hall. An oak one that says 'GLUB', a maplewood one that says 'NAK', and a rosewood one that says 'THIP'. There's also a ladder leading to a hatch above you, or you could head back through the tunnel to the backyard.

exits.description: the other end of the tunnel, leading to the backyard
exits.travelMessage: You pass around several corners and are delighted to see the tunnel end in a patch of light. You climb out and see your familiar pogo ride next to you. You've made it into your backyard.

exits.description: a ladder leading up to a hatch in the ceiling of the tunnel
exits.travelMessage: You climb up the ladder and throw open the hatch. You go through and find yourself in complete darkness, and you trip and accidentally slam the hatch shut behind you! Looks like you won't be going back that way. After fumbling about a bit more, you find a door and walk out of your pantry into your kitchen.

exits.description: an old oak door, with a placard reading 'GLUB' next to it
exits.travelMessage: You heave open the heavy oak door and walk into a well-lit sitting room. The door closes behind you.

exits.description: an old... maple door?! Who makes a door out of maple?! Anyways, this one is. And there's a sign next to it that says 'NAK'.
exits.travelMessage: You manage to pull open the maple door, which looks suspiciously like flooring. As you walk through, a soft blue glow hits your skin.

exits.description: a gorgeous rosewood door with intricate designs carved into it, under a well-crafted sign-board with 'THIP' eloquently carved into it
exits.travelMessage: The rosewood door opens easily without a hitch or a single creak, and you go on through.

rooms.label: CROC_FOYER
rooms.name: the investor room
rooms.description:
You're standing in a lounge-looking room covered in plush couches with huge big-screen TVs lining the walls. The screens are showing market trend lines moving up and down, tickers scrolling across showing sale prices of various stock symbols, and huge green and red text accompanied by a plus sign or minus as approriate flashing across the screens. This place looks like the trading floor of the New York Stock Exchange combined with a casino.

Strangely, it seems completely deserted. Oh well. You guess you could head back NORTH through the maplewood door to the tunnel, once you're done here.

exits.description: a maplewood door leading back to the underground tunnel
exits.travelMessage: You decide to leave the excitment of Wall Street to the bankers and head back through the maplewood door into the tunnel.

rooms.label: IGUANA_FOYER
rooms.name: the swimming room
rooms.description:
You can hardly believe your eyes but, you're standing in an indoor swimming pool room. Well, a small one anyways. There's various pool equipment and pool-side chairs lining a small pool about the size of a large sedan, and the air is uncomfortably heavy with moisture. Whoever hung out here must have really enjoyed swimming.

You don't have a swimsuit on you and you aren't confident enough that you're alone to risk go skinny-dipping, so all there is to do is go back NORTH through the rosewood door to the tunnel.

exits.description: a rosewood door leading back to the underground tunnel
exits.travelMessage: You go back to the tunnel, glad to be away from the humidity of the pool room.

rooms.label: SALAMANDER_FOYER
rooms.name: The room of salamanders going GLUB
rooms.description:
Oh this is absolutely a test room used for wandering NPCs. Though, it's very cold and damp, with breezes going by every now and then.

You can go NORTH through a doorway or SOUTH back into the tunnel via the oak door.

exits.description: an oak door leading back to the underground tunnel.
exits.travelMessage: You go back through the oak door into the tunnel.

exits.description: Just a normal opening into FORK-A.
exits.travelMessage: You make your way into the Salamander version of Fork-A.

rooms.label: SALAMANDER_OFFICE_FORK
rooms.name: the first forking room of salamander caves
rooms.description:
This is the first forking point in the Salamander caves. The ground is covered in dinner forks. Hilarious.

You can go through a SOUTH doorway back to the foyer, NORTH into a inner hall, or WEST into a side passage leading to the Salamander offices.

exits.description: doorway back to the foyer
exits.travelMessage: You go back into the foyer.

exits.description: The side passage of salamander land.
exits.travelMessage: You enter the side passage.

exits.description: hall deep within salamander territory. Full of glubs, and... is that a knife on the ground?
exits.travelMessage: You enter the hall to the sound of glubs echoing about.

rooms.label: SALAMANDER_OFFICE_FRONT
rooms.name: the salamander accountancy room
rooms.description:
You are in the front half of a well-lit office workspace covered in desks and workstations. Various whiteboards are covered in variations of the words 'glub', 'business', and 'profit', along with several pie charts and graphs you can't make sense of. There's a large partition on the north end of the room separating your side from the rest, but there's a gap in it for going from one side to another.

From here you can go EAST, though the way is paved in dinner forks, or NORTH into the back of the room.

exits.description: a doorway with dinner forks covering the ground
exits.travelMessage: The ground clinks as you step into the fork room.

exits.descrption: the back half of the large office room, separated from where you are with a partition
exits.travelMessage: You walk around the partition.

rooms.label: SALAMANDER_OFFICE_BACK
rooms.name: the salamander records room
rooms.description:
You are in the back half of the salamander office. This side is covered in drab corporate paintings and lights specifically designed to cast an eerie green glow on everything. File cabinets are vaguely organized against a wall, though the huge pile of papers on the ground shows that this didn't do much. There's an iron partition with an opening in it to the south separating this half of room from the rest.

From here you could go SOUTH to the front of the room, or EAST, though the way east is paved in spoons.

exits.description: a doorway with dinner spoons covering the ground
exits.travelMessage: You nearly faceplant after tripping on a spoon, but manage to find your balance as you walk into the spoon room.

exits.description: the front half of the large office room, spearated from where you are with a partition
exits.travelMessage: You step around the partition.

rooms.label: SALAMANDER_OFFICE_SPOON
rooms.name: the second forking room of the salamanders
rooms.description:
You are at the end of a series of rooms leading to either the entrance of the salamander caves, dinner, or both. The ground is littered in dinner spoons that someone has been hoarding.

From here, you can head SOUTH to a hall that has a knife on the ground, or to the WEST you can see a soft green glow coming from a doorway.

exits.description: a doorway leading to a room with pale green light spilling out, with a label reading 'RECKARDS' above it
exits.travelMessage: You step through the doorway and into the sickly light.

exits.description: a narrow hallway with a few knives on the ground
exits.travelMessage: You carefully avoid the fallen knives as you step into the hall. Glubs echo about as you do.

rooms.label: SALAMANDER_HALL
rooms.name: an inner hall within the Salamander caves
rooms.description:
You are in a hall connecting the fork and spoon rooms of the Salamander caves. True to theme, this one has *KNIVES* in it, although instead of being completely strewn across the floor, these ones are nicely racked on the wall. Well, most of them. There's still the occasional fallen knife on the ground, which you are very careful to avoid as you walk about.

There's a shelf set into one of the walls, which has a tape recorder and a speaker on it. The recorder keeps playing someone saying 'glub' over and over again.

There is a door to the side with 'treasure' scrawled on a sign nearby.

From here you can go NORTH to a room that has spoons on the gound, SOUTH to a room that has forks on the ground, or you can go EAST through the treasure door.

exits.description: a room at the north end of the hall, with the ground covered in spoons
exits.travelMessage: You make your way carefully to the north end of the knife hall, and you step into the spoon room.

exits.description: a room at the south end of the hall, with the ground covered in forks
exits.travelMessage: You pick your way across the knives on the ground to the south end of the hall and step into the fork room.

exits.description: a heavy metal door with a hand-written sign reading 'TREASURE' next to it
exits.travelMessage: Despite looking like it should be locked, the metal door opens easily and you step into a small vault.

rooms.label: SALAMANDER_TREASURE
rooms.name: the salamander's vault
rooms.description:
You are in a small vault. The ceiling is low and there's plenty of light to see that the room has been stripped bare. There are shelves and drawers that look like they once held great riches, but now are completely empty.

Kind of a bummer, but then the fact that there was a hole in your yard leading to this place should have been a tip that perhaps you and/or your family and possibly others had completely explored this place already.

There's only once entrance from here, and that's back to the knife hall you came from via the vault door to the WEST.

exits.description: a heavy open door that once hid the contents of this vault away behind lock and key
exits.travelMessage: You go back into the hall and pull the vault door shut behind you. Best to leave things as you found them.

npcs.label: IMP
npcs.name: Wanderer, the wandering imp
npcs.description: A weird imp covered in strange ink. It's wearing a jester's hat and has a surprisingly cat-like face.

npcs.label: JOEYC
npcs.name: Joey Claire, gumshoe extraordinaire

pronouns.COMMENT: if a key is missing, it will try to be assumed for the common ones (he/her/they and a few spivaks), else it will default to they/them/theirs
pronouns.COMMENT2: alternatively, specifying she/her, he/him, they/them, some pre-defined key (or defininig one elsewhere in world file) is allowed instead of inline pronoun setting

npcs.COMMENT_movement: (case-insensitive) can be STATIC, empty, null: remain in start, PATROL: follow patrol path [WIP], WANDER: char can wander each turn, includes either 'BLOCK_LIST', or 'ALLOW_LIST' of some kind.

dialog.COMMENT_type: can be LINE/empty/null for 'just say content, then go to next in list', or CHOICE for convo tree.
dialog.COMMENT_label: label is optional but provides a way to refer to a convo for choice.
dialog.COMMENT_response: not having response is okay but it will default to (cont...)

dialog: alternate syntax: " just having a string implies type=line, content of string, response of null

dialog.label: IM_WANDERER
dialog.content: Oh, wow! It's nice to meet you, I haven't seen other people here in a long, long time!

dialog.label: IM_PLAYER
dialog.content: Your name is PLAYER? That's a weird name!

npcs.description: A girl dressed in typical 90's gear, complete with a kaleidoscope of colors. She's carrying around a magnifying glass and looking over the wall, stopping every few moments to examine a spot under her magnifying glass.
